alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Clay; Dawson; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Greeley; Hall; Hamilton; Harlan; Howard; Kearney; Merrick; Nance; Phelps; Polk; Sherman; Valley; Webster; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 18 at 3:25AM CST until January 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations mainly 6 to 12 inches. Higher amounts of 13 to 16 inches are possible for areas northwest of a line from Elwood to Saint Paul to Fullerton. Winds will average 15 to 25 MPH with highest gusts of 30 to 35 MPH, initially out of the northeast but then turning northwesterly Wednesday night. This will mainly be a snow event for areas from the Tri Cities north and west. A narrow swath of ice accumulations of a tenth to around a quarter of an inch as well as snowfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches is expected between Highway 6 and the state line, south and east of Hastings. * WHERE...Portions of south central Nebraska. * WHEN...Through midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult in the warned area, and perhaps impossible in areas where snow is heaviest. Blowing snow and occasionally heavy snow rates could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will develop in time to impact the morning commute and continue through the evening commute. Lingering impacts into at least Thursday morning are likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While minor forecast adjustments remain possible, forecast confidence has increased enough that significant snow accumulation will indeed occur.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
